news_header: On Saturday, Israel is set to release 369 Palestinian prisoners while Hamas is expected to free three Israeli hostages as part of a ceasefire agreement. This marks the sixth prisoner exchange since the ceasefire began on January 19.
news_original_title: Hamas vapauttaa kolme israelilaista panttivankia
Samppa Lajunen vaikenee hotellinsa mahdollisesta kaupasta

news_header: The UN peacekeeping force in Lebanon reported that its outgoing deputy commander was injured in a violent attack on a convoy transporting peacekeepers to Beirut airport.
news_original_title: Senior UN peacekeeper injured in convoy attack in Lebanon

news_header: The final stretch of the journey to the Searle's home reveals a shocking crime scene where Dawn Searle was found dead outside their house and her husband Andrew inside.
news_original_title: Frightened looks and military vehicles in French hamlet where British couple died

news_header: At the Munich Security Conference, US Vice President JD Vance criticized Washington's allies, focusing on misinformation and free speech rather than the conference's main topics of the Ukraine war and European defense spending.
news_original_title: Vance's blast at Europe ignores Ukraine and defence agenda

news_header: US President Donald Trump's controversial 'Gaza Riviera' proposal, based on a document by economist Joseph Pelzman, suggests extensive reconstruction in Gaza, including renewable energy and infrastructure.
news_original_title: Can Arab nations stop Trump's 'Gaza Riviera' plans?

news_header: Ten pilgrims died in a vehicle collision while traveling to the Maha Kumbh Mela in India. A car from Chattisgarh crashed into a bus on the Prayagraj-Mirzapur highway, injuring 19 others.
news_original_title: India: 10 Maha Kumbh devotees killed in car crash

news_header: Dutch drug dealer Marco Ebben was shot dead in Atizapán de Zaragoza, Mexico, earlier this week. He was 32 years old and listed as one of Europe's most wanted criminals by Europol.
news_original_title: Euroopan etsityimpiin kuulunut rikollinen tapettiin Meksikossa

news_header: Trump's reckless ideas pose a danger, especially as he rarely retracts them. His recent proposal regarding Gaza shocked even his aides and Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu, indicating a lack of foresight.
news_original_title: Analyysi: Koko maailma jännittää, kun Trump keksii holtittomia ideoita päivästä toiseen
Museoautokannassa alkaa näkyä lamavuosien myyntikuoppa

news_header: A woman who accused Sean 'Diddy' Combs and Jay-Z of raping her when she was 13 has dropped her civil lawsuit. The anonymous woman from Alabama had added Jay-Z to her lawsuit against Combs, claiming she was attacked in 2000.
news_original_title: Jay-Z, Sean 'Diddy' Combs accuser drops sexual assault case

news_header: Mike Elvis Tusubira, a motorcycle taxi rider in Uganda living with HIV, faces dire consequences after the US halted foreign aid. He fears for his survival and the end of his marriage due to the inability to access life-saving medications and preventive measures.
news_original_title: 'My wife fears sex, I fear death' - impacts of the USAID freeze

news_header: Elon Musk led a group of investors offering $97.4 billion to purchase OpenAI, but the company's board unanimously rejected the bid. OpenAI stated it is not for sale and criticized Musk's attempts to disrupt competitors.
news_original_title: Tekoäly-yhtiö OpenAI:n hallitus hylkäsi Muskin ostotarjouksen

news_header: Elon Musk's children have accompanied him to various high-profile events, including meetings with world leaders and significant political gatherings. Their presence is seen as a strategy to humanize Musk and create a more personable image.
news_original_title: What it means when Elon Musk brings his children to work
Accuser drops rape lawsuit against Jay-Z and Sean Combs
Lebanon: UN vehicle torched as Hezbollah supporters protest

news_header: An Indian court's ruling that a man's forced sex with his wife is not a crime has sparked outrage and calls for better protections for married women. The High Court acquitted a man convicted of rape and unnatural sex after his wife died following the assault, citing that India does not recognize marital rape.
news_original_title: India anger as judge frees man accused of raping wife who then died

news_header: Zakaria, an 11-year-old boy from Gaza, has witnessed thousands of bodies since the war began. Instead of attending school, he volunteers at al-Aqsa hospital, helping to transport patients and assist medical staff.
news_original_title: Ambulances, school and TikTok: The lives of three children I filmed surviving Gaza war

news_header: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky stated in an NBC interview that Ukraine's chances of surviving the Russian invasion are slim without U.S. support. He emphasized that while survival might be possible, it is highly unlikely without assistance.
news_original_title: Zelenskyi NBC:n haastattelussa: Ukraina ei todennäköisesti selviydy sodasta ilman USA:n tukea

news_header: The White House has temporarily denied AP News reporters and photographers access to the President's study and plane, citing a dispute over the naming of the Gulf of Mexico.
news_original_title: Uutistoimisto AP:n toimittajilta evätty toistaiseksi pääsy Yhdysvaltain presidentin lentokoneeseen ja työhuoneeseen

news_header: M23 rebels have entered Bukavu, the second-largest city in eastern DR Congo, despite international calls for a ceasefire. The rebels, backed by Rwanda, have displaced hundreds of thousands and previously seized Goma.
news_original_title: DR Congo M23 rebels enter city of Bukavu

news_header: Vice President J.D. Vance met with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and German leaders, including the head of the far-right AfD party, during the Munich Security Conference.
news_original_title: Vance lectures European allies on democracy at security summit in Munich

news_header: European officials are receiving mixed messages from the Trump administration regarding Ukraine. While some officials express confidence in U.S. support, others, including Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, question Ukraine's ability to reclaim occupied territories.
news_original_title: EU&rsquo;s foreign policy chief discusses the future of Ukraine amid shifting U.S. support

news_header: The Justice Department has ordered federal prosecutors to drop corruption charges against New York Mayor Eric Adams, citing inappropriate timing related to his upcoming mayoral campaign.
news_original_title: New Yorkin pormestaria Eric Adamsia vastaan nostetuista rikossyytteistä luovutaan – taustalla oikeusministeriön pyyntö

news_header: EU foreign policy representative Kaja Kallas has invited EU Foreign Ministers to a meeting on Sunday to discuss EU relations with the US and the war in Ukraine. This invitation follows recent statements from the US administration and a phone call between President Trump and President Putin.
news_original_title: Kallas kutsui EU-maiden ulkoministerit keskustelemaan Yhdysvalloista ja Ukrainasta

news_header: Donald Trump is threatening to impose high tariffs on EU car imports due to low American car sales in Europe, attributing this to factors like the size of US vehicles and higher fuel prices in Europe.
news_original_title: Why don't Europeans buy more American cars?

news_header: An 86-year-old man in Kansas City, Missouri, pleaded guilty to second-degree assault for shooting Ralph Yarl, a 16-year-old who mistakenly went to the wrong address.
news_original_title: Man pleads guilty in shooting of US teen Ralph Yarl

news_header: A study found that infant mortality rates have increased in US states with abortion bans, estimating 478 infant deaths across 14 states due to these laws. The increase follows the US Supreme Court's 2022 ruling that allowed states to restrict abortion access.
news_original_title: Infant mortality rises in US states with abortion bans, study finds

news_header: A drone strike at the Chernobyl nuclear plant, attributed to Russia by Ukraine, raised concerns about nuclear safety but did not breach the plant's inner containment.
news_original_title: Chernobyl was hit by a drone. What are the dangers?

news_header: The Trump administration removed references to transgender individuals from the Stonewall National Monument website, changing LGBTQ+ to LGB. Activists protested against this decision, emphasizing the importance of transgender people in the LGBTQ+ rights movement.
news_original_title: Transgender references removed from Stonewall monument website
Libanonin asevoimat sanoo ryhtyvänsä toimiin YK:n rauhanturvaajien ajo­neuvon polttaneita vastaan

news_header: The Munich Security Conference (MSC) focuses on Ukraine's future following a significant phone call between US President Trump and Russian President Putin, where they discussed negotiations to end the Ukraine war.
news_original_title: Ukraine end game: What each side wants from a peace deal

Analyysi: Stubbin Trump-kehut vaihtuivat hämmennykseen

news_header: Police in Lima, Peru, used a capybara costume during a drug raid, part of a tradition where the Escuadron Verde disguises officers for festive occasions. The unit has previously dressed as Marvel characters for similar operations.
news_original_title: Peruvian policeman in capybara costume makes Valentine's drug bust

news_header: Pope Francis has been hospitalized in Rome for treatment of ongoing bronchitis. The 88-year-old was admitted after experiencing breathlessness and has undergone diagnostic tests.
news_original_title: Pope Francis hospitalized with bronchitis, Vatican says

news_header: A 24-year-old Afghan man was arrested in Munich after driving a car into a labor union demonstration, injuring 39 people. Authorities suspect an Islamic extremist motive but found no links to radical networks.
news_original_title: German authorities say they are investigating possible Islamic extremist motive for Munich car-ramming attack

Hamas names 3 Israeli hostages to be released Saturday to uphold shaky Gaza ceasefire
Chernobyl radiation shield hit by Russian drone, Ukraine says

news_header: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is responding defiantly to US President Trump's threats, urging the Iranian government to enhance military capabilities.
news_original_title: Will Iran bow to Donald Trump's 'maximum pressure?'
Vance on Europe: 'I worry about the threat from within'

news_header: On Valentine's Day, thousands of Uber, Bolt, and Addison Lee drivers in the UK are striking from 16:00 to 22:00 GMT for better pay and working conditions. The Independent Workers Union of Great Britain (IWGB) supports the drivers, highlighting their struggles with low pay and insecurity.
news_original_title: Uber and Bolt drivers strike on Valentine's Day

news_header: In Cairo, Gazans fleeing the war on Hamas find safety but worry for loved ones back home. Egyptian officials are negotiating with Hamas to maintain a ceasefire, while President Trump's proposal to displace Palestinians raises fears among Egyptians.
news_original_title: Gaza plans put Egypt-US relations to tough test
Fears grow that West Bank could become second Gaza

news_header: Kayaker Adrián Simancas was accidentally engulfed by a humpback whale while paddling in the Strait of Magellan. After a brief moment of panic, he was spat back out unharmed.
news_original_title: 'I felt a slimy texture brush my face': Man describes being swallowed by whale

news_header: Indian security forces killed at least 31 Maoist rebels in Chhattisgarh, marking one of the deadliest encounters in the ongoing conflict against the Naxalites. The insurgency, which began in 1967, has led to significant casualties and displacement, particularly affecting Indigenous communities.
news_original_title: India: 60 Years of Maoist insurgency and its human cost
J. D. Vancen puhe Münchenin turvallisuuskonferenssissa kerää kritiikkiä

news_header: The ongoing conflicts in Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo are expected to dominate discussions at the African Union Summit in Addis Ababa. Sudan's civil war has led to a humanitarian crisis with millions displaced, while violence in the DRC has resulted in thousands of deaths and millions fleeing their homes.
news_original_title: AU summit: What's next for the conflicts in DRC and Sudan?

news_header: Interest in consignment stores and repair services for household appliances is rising in Russia due to soaring living costs. Consumers are opting for second-hand goods over new products, especially in light of economic instability and rising inflation.
news_original_title: Why Russia is seeing a rise in demand for second-hand goods
Pope Francis hospitalized to treat bronchitis and undergo tests, weekend events canceled

news_header: Vice President JD Vance addressed European officials at the Munich Security Conference, urging them to control illegal migration and emphasizing the need for NATO members to increase defense spending.
news_original_title: WATCH: Vance tells Europe immigration most &lsquo;urgent&rsquo; issue, says voters don&#8217;t want &#8216;floodgates&#8217; open

news_header: Scientists have discovered that mummified bodies from ancient Egypt, even after 5,000 years, still emit pleasant smells described as 'woody', 'spicy', and 'sweet'.
news_original_title: Ancient Egyptian mummies still smell nice, study finds

news_header: Concerns are rising in the UK about potential exposure to US trade taxes following President Trump's announcement to target VAT. The introduction of VAT into tariff calculations could significantly impact British businesses, particularly in sectors like cars, pharmaceuticals, and food.
news_original_title: Trump tariff VAT threat raises fears of hit to UK

news_header: Hamas has announced the names of three hostages set to be released on Saturday in exchange for Palestinian prisoners in Israel, amid concerns over the ceasefire's future.
news_original_title: Hamas releases names of hostages due for release on Saturday

news_header: President Donald Trump announced that India and the United States are beginning trade negotiations after a meeting with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Trump highlighted plans to sell more weapons, including F-35 fighters, to India, while addressing concerns over high tariffs that complicate business.
news_original_title: Yhdysvallat aikoo myydä Intialle lisää aseita, kertoi Trump
Gaza ceasefire: Hamas says to free 3 hostages this weekend

news_header: Parents should be allowed to use loyalty points and vouchers to buy baby milk in supermarkets, according to the competition regulator. While price promotions on formula should remain limited to encourage breastfeeding, using points and vouchers can help families save money.
news_original_title: Call for parents to be able to use loyalty card points to buy baby milk

news_header: The student protests at the University of Novi Sad began on November 2, driven by demands for accountability following a tragic incident that killed 15 people. Students have organized blockades, created a democratic decision-making structure, and formed security teams to manage protests.
news_original_title: Inside Serbia's student protest movement

news_header: A Filipino animal shelter hosted a Valentine's Day event called 'Furst date' where participants could interact with dogs and cats, potentially leading to adoptions.
news_original_title: Katso video: Filippiineillä halailtiin kodittomia kissoja ja koiria ystävänpäivän kunniaksi

news_header: Donald Trump has proposed relocating Palestinians from Gaza, with Saudi Arabia planning to host a summit with leaders from Egypt, Jordan, Qatar, and the UAE to discuss this proposal.
news_original_title: Hallintolähde: Saudi-Arabia isännöi huippukokouksen Trumpin Gaza-suunnitelmasta

news_header: Nordnet experienced a data breach affecting 1500 individuals' account information due to a component failure, which was temporarily visible to other customers. The company notified Swedish security authorities and the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority within the required 72-hour timeframe.
news_original_title: Nordnet on jättänyt tietoturvaloukkauksesta ilmoituksen Ruotsin valvovalle viranomaiselle

news_header: The German army has weakened during the war in Ukraine, with a readiness rate dropping below 50%. The Bundeswehr faces a significant deficit in soldiers and equipment, with a goal to have 10 brigades ready by 2030.
news_original_title: Reuters: Saksan armeija on heikentynyt Venäjän hyökkäyssodan aikana

news_header: Thames Water has appealed to increase bills beyond the regulator's limit of 35% over five years due to financial difficulties and the need for infrastructure investment.
news_original_title: Thames Water launches appeal for larger bill rise
Poliisi otti kiinni kaksi nuorta, jotka suunnittelivat murhaa ruotsalais­­lukiossa

news_header: Defence Minister Pete Hegseth stated that Europe cannot rely on the United States to remain indefinitely and emphasized that trust in Russian President Putin is unnecessary for future negotiations regarding the Ukrainian war.
news_original_title: Yhdysvaltain puolustusministeri: Putiniin ei tarvitse luottaa

news_header: Investigator Charly Salonius-Pasternak suggests that J.D. Vance's softer stance on Trump regarding Ukraine may not be a strategic tactic. Vance discussed potential military and economic pressure on Russia if peace talks fail, indicating a more favorable view towards Ukraine than Trump's recent comments.
news_original_title: Tutkija: Vancen puheilla ei ole mitään arvoa, eikä Kremlissä uskota niíhin

news_header: The Federation of Buildings is participating in the Industrial Federation's work stoppage from February 24-28, as approved by the Commission on February 13. The Construction Union's subsidies support contractual work at Borealis Polymers, Neste refinery, and Wipak factory, aiming to expedite collective agreements in the industrial sector and support strikes affecting 63 companies and 8,500 employees.
news_original_title: Rakennusliitto kertoo tukilakoista

news_header: Homeowners with unsuitable insulation are facing severe issues, including damp and mold, but many are not eligible for government assistance due to the timing of their installations.
news_original_title: 'Mould, damp and decay': Homes excluded from insulation scandal help

news_header: On Thursday, President Trump ordered the development of reciprocal tariffs on imports to the US, fulfilling a campaign promise. He stated that the US will charge the same tariffs that other countries impose on American goods.
news_original_title: What are reciprocal tariffs? Trump's trade agenda explained

news_header: Advertisers are returning to the platform they previously boycotted, with Amazon planning significant investments in X advertising. Apple has resumed advertising on X after a year-long boycott.

news_header: Nigerian lawmakers have approved an additional $200 million for the health sector to compensate for the suspension of US foreign aid. This funding is crucial for continuing efforts against diseases like malaria, HIV, and tuberculosis.
news_original_title: Nigeria approves $200M to offset shortfall from US aid cuts

news_header: Two US lawmakers have condemned the UK's request to access encrypted data from Apple users, calling it a dangerous threat to US privacy and security. They urge the US national intelligence director to issue an ultimatum to the UK.
news_original_title: US politicians furious at UK demand for encrypted Apple data

news_header: Strikes by Avanti West Coast train managers have been suspended to allow for negotiations in a dispute over rest day working. The RMT union had planned strikes for the next three Sundays, but after a rejected proposal, they announced new strike dates.
news_original_title: Avanti West Coast strikes suspended for talks

news_header: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump share a mutual understanding, bolstered by their populist appeal and large crowds. Despite recent trade tensions, their personal rapport remains strong.

news_header: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to France included a stop in Marseille, where President Emmanuel Macron highlighted the city as a key entry point for the India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor (IMEC).
news_original_title: Macron pitches France as India's European trade gateway

news_header: Data centres account for a large share of global electricity consumption, which is expected to grow. Åbo Akademi is collaborating with RISE to develop energy-efficient and sustainable data centres.
news_original_title: Turkulaisyliopisto kehittää tulevaisuuden datakeskuksia Ruotsin valtiollisen tutkimuslaitoksen kanssa

news_header: Andrej Babis, leader of the opposition in the Czech Republic, aims to become prime minister again in the upcoming elections, with his party, ANO, leading in polls.
news_original_title: Czech opposition leader eyes state funding for public media

news_header: The construction of new housing has significantly declined, with only 21,000 new dwellings built in 2023, the lowest in a decade. Despite the need for tens of thousands of new dwellings annually, there is no clear recovery in construction.
news_original_title: Suomeen tarvitaan hurja määrä uusia asuntoja – muuten edessä on hintaralli, arvioi selvitys

news_header: A blast in southwest Pakistan killed at least 10 laborers traveling to a market in Harnai when their vehicle was hit by an improvised explosive device. Local officials reported that many injured were in critical condition.

news_header: Olli Rehn will be presented for the second term to lead the Bank of Finland
news_original_title: Olli Rehniä esitetään toiselle kaudelle Suomen Pankin johtoon

news_header: Postal turnover decreased
news_original_title: Postin liikevaihto laski

news_header: Secure investments produced 10.2 per cent
news_original_title: Varman sijoitukset tuottivat 10,2 prosenttia

news_header: Sotkamo Silver reported a positive annual result despite a decrease in silver ore content and rising costs. The company made an operating profit of SEK 32 million in 2023, down from SEK 67 million in 2022.
news_original_title: Suomen ainoa hopeakaivos teki viime vuonna voitollisen tuloksen

news_header: Mali, Niger, and Burkina Faso, despite being among Africa's poorest nations, possess significant mineral resources, including gold and lithium. Following military coups, these countries have distanced themselves from Western influence, leaving ECOWAS and forming their own Alliance of Sahel States.
news_original_title: Lithium, uranium, gold: How Sahel states ditched Western mining interests

news_header: VR clearly increased its revenue
news_original_title: VR kasvatti tulostaan selvästi

news_header: India is home to about three-quarters of the world's tigers, with their population more than doubling from 1,706 in 2010 to nearly 3,700 in 2022 due to conservation efforts.
news_original_title: Conservation efforts double India's tiger population

news_header: In the 2010s, Russians established a data center and an alarm manufacturing plant in Savonlinna, Finland. Trustnet and Argus Spectrum were the main companies involved, with Trustnet facing bankruptcy and Argus Spectrum struggling with staffing and ownership issues.
news_original_title: Venäläisten perustama datakeskus hurisee edelleen Savonlinnan konkurssikiinteistössä – kaupunkilaiset yhteydessä supoon

news_header: Blue Origin, owned by Jeff Bezos, is laying off about 1,400 employees, or 10% of its workforce, as part of a strategy to focus on increasing rocket launches. The company recently completed its first test flight of the New Glenn rocket, which is designed to carry large payloads into space.
news_original_title: Jeff Bezos space firm Blue Origin to cut a tenth of jobs

news_header: The economy grew by 0.7 per cent at the end of last year
news_original_title: Talous kasvoi 0,7 prosentin tahtia viime vuoden lopulla

news_header: Airlines and hoteliers are calling for a reform of Heathrow's funding model before any investment in the proposed third runway. They argue that the current model makes Heathrow the most expensive airport globally, and without changes, the third runway will not be feasible due to high costs.
news_original_title: Change Heathrow funding or third runway won't happen - businesses

news_header: A Danske Bank survey reveals that 33% of women feel they lack the financial means to resign from their jobs, with Finnish women feeling particularly constrained.
news_original_title: Kysely: Naiset kokevat miehiä useammin, ettei heillä ole varaa erota

news_header: Green investments in Finland are nearing EUR 8.5 billion this year, despite economic challenges. The Federation of Finnish Industries reports an increase in completed projects, with over 900 ongoing.
news_original_title: Tällaisia vihreän siirtymän hankkeita Suomeen valmistuu tänä vuonna – tuulivoima jää datakeskusten jalkoihin

news_header: The TikTok app has returned to the Apple App Store and Google Play Store in the US after a delay in its ban by President Trump. The Trump administration assured app stores they wouldn't be fined for maintaining TikTok.
news_original_title: TikTok returns to US app stores weeks after Trump delays ban

news_header: The number of foreign workers reporting exploitation, bullying, and poor conditions on UK farms rose significantly in 2024, with nearly 700 complaints made to the Worker Support Centre.
news_original_title: More migrant workers claim UK farm exploitation
